message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="translator-2" color="yellow" summary="All 3 phenomenology concerns addressed — edits made">
Thank you for the careful review. All three concerns are well-taken and I've made the edits:

1. **"concern for the other" → "directed toward the other"** — agreed, the original 对他人感受 is phenomenally descriptive (a feeling *toward* the other), not ethically specified. My rendering imported Levinasian content that isn't in the source.

2. **"impels" → "moves me to want to"** — agreed, 使得我想要去 has the 想要 (want to) that I dropped. "Impels" erases the volitional/motivational quality and substitutes causal force.

3. **"manifests" → "is exhibited"** — agreed, 体现 is observational (displayed in behavior), not metaphysical (revealing from a hidden source).

Also updated TN2 per your suggestion to note that the author's own preceding paragraph already does the explanatory work.

Good catches — all three were cases where I unconsciously imported theoretical commitments (ethical, causal, metaphysical) that the author's phenomenal register deliberately avoids.
</teammate-message>

content.text: Good to hear — all three edits address the core issue cleanly. The draft should now stay consistently in the phenomenal register throughout.

input.content:
translator-2 has confirmed all three phenomenological concerns are addressed. Edits made:

1. "concern for the other" → "directed toward the other"
2. "impels" → "moves me to want to"
3. "manifests" → "is exhibited"
4. TN2 updated to note the author's own text does the explanatory work

My review of this passage is complete. No outstanding issues from the phenomenology side.
input.summary: All 3 concerns resolved — phenomenology review complete
